title.value: Inferring global-scale temporal latent topics from news reports to predict public health interventions for COVID-19
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated at the beginning of the article and in multiple sections of the paper, which is a standard in academic writing.
title.quote: Inferring global-scale temporal latent topics from news reports to predict public health interventions for COVID-19

extractions.description: The paper presents a machine learning model named EpiTopics aimed at automating the detection and prediction of non-pharmacological interventions (NPI) changes related to COVID-19 from news reports. Using a combination of topic modeling and transfer learning, the model identifies topics from a large set of unlabeled news reports and associates these topics with NPIs to predict changes in their status across 42 countries.

type.justification: The paper primarily involves the development and evaluation of a machine learning model (EpiTopics) using real-world data sets, which categorizes it as an empirical study.
type.quote: We show that it is possible to train an interpretable deep-learning model called EpiTopics on media news data to predict...

name.justification: The paper focuses on mining and analyzing text data from COVID-19 news reports using topic modeling, a subfield of Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: At the center of our approach is the use of probabilistic topic modeling, which facilitates the interpretation of our results and is well suited to the noisy nature of online media.

name.justification: The focus of the analysis is on predicting public health interventions related to COVID-19 using the mined topics from news data.
name.quote: We developed a machine learning model called EpiTopics toward automatic detection of the changes in the status of non-pharmacological interventions (NPI) for COVID-19 from news reports.

name.justification: The model uses transfer learning to improve prediction accuracy and to handle the scarcity of labeled data.
name.quote: EpiTopics uses a 3-stage, transfer-learning algorithm to classify documents according to NPI categories, relying on topic modeling to support result interpretation.

name.justification: EpiTopics is mentioned repeatedly as the primary machine learning model developed and tested in the study for predicting NPIs.
name.quote: We present EpiTopics, a machine learning approach to support automation of NPI prediction and monitoring at both the document level and country level by mining the vast amount of unlabeled news reports on COVID-19.

is_contributed.justification: EpiTopics is introduced as a novel framework specifically developed for the purposes outlined in this study.
is_contributed.quote: We present EpiTopics, a machine learning approach to support automation of NPI prediction...

is_executed.justification: Although the model is discussed extensively, the execution environment (GPU/CPU) is not specified.

is_compared.justification: The EpiTopics model is compared to baseline methods using AUPRC scores, demonstrating its performance.
is_compared.quote: EpiTopics outperformed the 2 baseline methods by a large margin, highlighting the benefit of incorporating topic mixtures.

referenced_paper_title.value: Global surveillance of covid-19 by mining news media using a multi-source dynamic embedded topic model
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper appears to be a precursor or related work that introduces similar concepts used in developing EpiTopics.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We present a machine learning framework that uses online media reports to monitor changes in the status of NPIs...

name.justification: AYLIEN is the dataset used for unsupervised learning of topics from a large number of COVID-19 news reports without NPI labels.
name.quote: We used an open-access dataset of articles publicly released by an AI news company AYLIEN, which included 1.2 million news articles about COVID-19...

referenced_paper_title.value: AI-assisted tracking of worldwide non-pharmaceutical interventions for COVID-19.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper uses the AYLIEN dataset as part of its analysis for topic modeling in their machine learning framework.
referenced_paper_title.quote: AI-assisted tracking of worldwide non-pharmaceutical interventions for COVID-19.

name.justification: WHO-PHSM is the labeled dataset used for training the model to predict 15 categories of NPIs.
name.quote: We used the trained topic mixture encoder from stage 1 to infer the topic mixture of the 2,000 WHO news reports.

aliases: World Health Organization Public Health and Social Measures Dataset

referenced_paper_title.value: COVID-19 government response event dataset (coronanet v. 1.0).
referenced_paper_title.justification: This WHO dataset provides the manual labels necessary for supervised learning in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: WHO Public Health and Social Measures (WHO-PHSM) dataset
